Detailed Description

A complete MACSim server.

A complete MACSim server, this class creates and manages both configuration and simulation pipes using information provided by calling the MACSimServerInterface specified at construct time.

Definition at line 194 of file macsim.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

MACSimServer::MACSimServer (  const char *  p_name,
MACSimServerInterface *  p_interface
) 
 

Constructor, itialises both pipes and member variables

Initialises m_name with p_name, and both pipes with the interface specified by p_interface. Pipes are not started running until one of the run() member functions is called

Parameters:
p_name The name of the server, used to generate running messages to stdout.
p_interface The interface to use to service configuration and simulation pipe requests.

Definition at line 65 of file macsim.cpp.

Member Function Documentation

void MACSimServer::run (  int  showMessage,
int  waitForKey
) 
 

Run function.

Runs the server. If showMessage is specified as non-zero a message is sent to stdout indicating that the server is running. If waitForKey is specified as non-zero the server waits for a key press on stdin before terminating. If waitForKey is specified, the server will terminate and then return. If not, this function will return immediately, the server must then be terminated using the terminate() member function.

Parameters:
showMessage If non-zero, running and termination messages are sent to stdout.
waitForKey If non-zero, the function waits for a key press on stdin then terminates the server before returning.

Definition at line 73 of file macsim.cpp.

void MACSimServer::run (   )  [inline]
 

Default run function.

Calls run(int,int) specifying non-zero for both showMessage and waitForKey.
